description.narrative: The Project has an anticipated AIMM rating of Satisfactory. The main expected project-level outcome stems from preserving and maximizing positive environmental effects by optimizing the performance of operating solar projects. Beyond the Project, by structuring the A loan as a certified green loan according to the internationally recognized green loan principles (GLP), the proposed investment is expected to increase integration by promoting green financing in a market with large climate-smart investment needs but limited local green financing capacity.

VN Green Holdings Pte. Ltd. (VNGH or the Company), is a Vietnam-focused, Singapore-based dedicated renewable energy (RE) platform founded in 2020 and wholly owned by Dragon Capital Group Limited (DCG). VNGH currently owns 49.5 MWp Quang Tri solar power plant located in Quang Tri province. VNGHs strategy is to own at least 300 MW of RE capacity in Vietnam by 2024 through the acquisition of operating wind and solar power projects and by developing greenfield RE projects. International Finance Corporation (IFC) - the private sector arm of the World Bank Group - is considering a senior, secured corporate loan to VNGH to finance the acquisition of (i) 40 MWp Mui Ne solar project; (ii) 33.1 MWp VSP II solar project; and (iii) other RE projects in Vietnam (the Project).
